name: Voicing in Plosives and Fricatives
long description: Voicing contrast in both plosives and fricatives

description: None missing in /p t k b d g/

name: Voicing and Gaps in Plosive Systems
Voicing and Gaps in Plosive Systems
Voicing and Gaps in Plosive Systems
Lateral Consonants
description: Laterals, but no /l/, no obstruent laterals
long description: Laterals, but no /l/, no obstruent lateral

name: Fixed Stress Locations
long description: Initial: stress is on the first syllable

name: Fixed Stress Locations
long description: Second: stress is on the second syllable

name: Fixed Stress Locations
long description: Third: stress is on the third syllable

name: Fixed Stress Locations
long description: Antepenultimate: stress is on the antepenultimate (third from the right) syllable

name: Fixed Stress Locations
long description: Penultimate: stress is on the penultimate (second from the right) syllable

name: Fixed Stress Locations
long description: Ultimate: stress is on the ultimate (last) syllable

name: Weight-Sensitive Stress
long description: Left-edge: Stress is on the first or second syllable

name: Weight-Sensitive Stress
description: Left-oriented: One of the first three
long description: Left-oriented: The third syllable is involved

name: Weight-Sensitive Stress
long description: Right-edge: Stress on ultimate or penultimate syllable

name: Weight-Sensitive Stress
description: Right-oriented: One of the last three

name: Weight-Sensitive Stress
long description: Unbounded: Stress can be anywhere in the word

name: Weight Factors in Weight-Sensitive Stress Systems
long description: No weight, or weight factor unknown

name: Weight Factors in Weight-Sensitive Stress Systems
long description: Long vowel: long vowels are heavy for stress

name: Weight Factors in Weight-Sensitive Stress Systems
long description: Coda consonant: closed syllables are heavy for stress

name: Weight Factors in Weight-Sensitive Stress Systems
long description: Long vowel + Coda: long vowels or closed syllables

name: Weight Factors in Weight-Sensitive Stress Systems
long description: Prominence: other factors are heavy for stress

name: Weight Factors in Weight-Sensitive Stress Systems
Weight Factors in Weight-Sensitive Stress Systems
long description: Combined: two of the above factors determine weight

name: Rhythm Types
long description: Trochaic: left-hand syllable in the foot is strong

name: Rhythm Types
long description: Iambic: right-hand syllable in the foot is strong

name: Rhythm Types
long description: Dual: system has both trochaic and iambic feet

Case Syncretism
long description: Inflectional case marking is absent or minimal

name: Case Syncretism
long description: Inflectional case marking is syncretic for core cases only

long description: Inflectional case marking is syncretic for core and non-core cases

name: Case Syncretism
long description: Inflectional case marking is never syncretic

name: Syncretism in Verbal Person/Number Marking
long description: Subject person/number marking is never syncretic

name: Coding of Nominal Plurality
long description: Plural by complete reduplication of stem

name: Coding of Nominal Plurality
long description: Morphological plural with no method primary

name: Occurrence of Nominal Plurality
long description: Plural only in human nouns, optional

name: Occurrence of Nominal Plurality
long description: Plural only in human nouns, obligatory

name: Occurrence of Nominal Plurality
long description: Plural in all nouns, always optional

name: Occurrence of Nominal Plurality
long description: Plural in all nouns, optional in inanimates

name: Occurrence of Nominal Plurality
long description: Plural in all nouns, always obligatory

name: Plurality in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Person-number stem with a pronominal plural affix

name: Plurality in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Person-number stem with a nominal plural affix

name: Plurality in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Person stem with a pronominal plural affix

name: Plurality in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Person stem with a nominal plural affix

name: The Associative Plural
long description: Associative plural marker also used for additive plurals

name: Definite Articles
description: Demonstrative word used as definite article
long description: Demonstrative word used as marker of definiteness

name: Definite Articles
long description: No definite article but indefinite article

name: Indefinite Articles
long description: Indefinite word distinct from numeral for 'one'

name: Indefinite Articles
long description: Numeral for 'one' is used as indefinite article

name: Indefinite Articles
long description: No indefinite article but definite article

name: Third Person Pronouns and Demonstratives
long description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are unrelated to demonstratives

name: Third Person Pronouns and Demonstratives
long description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related to all demonstratives

name: Third Person Pronouns and Demonstratives
long description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related to remote demonstratives

name: Third Person Pronouns and Demonstratives
long description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related to non-remote demonstratives

name: Third Person Pronouns and Demonstratives
long description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related by gender markers

name: Third Person Pronouns and Demonstratives
long description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related for non-human reference

name: Gender Distinctions in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Gender distinctions in 3rd person plus 1st and/or 2nd person

name: Gender Distinctions in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Gender distinctions in 3rd person only, but in both singular and non-singular

name: Gender Distinctions in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Gender distinctions in 3rd person singular only

name: Gender Distinctions in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Gender distinctions in 1st or 2nd person but not 3rd

name: Gender Distinctions in Independent Personal Pronouns
long description: Gender distinctions in 3rd person non-singular only

name: Gender Distinctions in Independent Personal Pronouns
Politeness Distinctions in Pronouns
long description: Second person pronouns encode no politeness distinction

name: Politeness Distinctions in Pronouns
long description: Second person pronouns encode a binary politeness distinction

name: Politeness Distinctions in Pronouns
long description: Second person pronouns encode multiple politeness distinctions

name: Politeness Distinctions in Pronouns
long description: Second person pronouns are dominantly avoided for politeness reasons

name: Intensifiers and Reflexive Pronouns
long description: Intensifiers and reflexive pronouns are formally identical

name: Intensifiers and Reflexive Pronouns
long description: Intensifiers and reflexive pronouns are formally differentiated

name: Person Marking on Adpositions
long description: Person marking for pronouns and nouns

name: Position of Case Affixes
long description: Case coded by changes within noun stem

name: Position of Case Affixes
long description: Mixed morphological case strategies with none primary

name: Position of Case Affixes
description: No case affixes or adpositional clitics
long description: Neither case affixes nor adpositional clitics

name: Ordinal Numerals
long description: Zero: Ordinal numerals do not exist

name: Ordinal Numerals
long description: One: No distinction of cardinal and ordinal numerals

name: Ordinal Numerals
long description: First: Cardinal and ordinal numerals are identical except for 'one' and 'first'

name: Ordinal Numerals
long description: One-th: One-th: Ordinal numerals are derived from cardinal numerals

name: Ordinal Numerals
long description: First/One-th: All ordinal numerals are derived from cardinal numerals with different allomorphs for 'first' one of which is morphologically independent of 'one'

name: Ordinal Numerals
long description: Two-th: Two-th: Ordinal numerals from 'two' upwards are derived from cardinal numerals, 'first' is suppletive

name: Ordinal Numerals
long description: Second: 'First' and a small set of consecutive higher ordinal numerals are suppletive

name: Distributive Numerals
description: Marked by mixed or other strategies
long description: Marked by mixed or other strategies

name: Conjunctions and Universal Quantifiers
long description: Formally similar, not involving interrogative expression

name: Position of Pronominal Possessive Affixes
long description: Both possessive prefixes and possessive suffixes, with neither primary

name: Genitives,2"
long description: Moderately differentiated, with genitives and adjectives collapsed

name: Genitives,3"
long description: Moderately differentiated, with genitives and relative clauses collapsed

name: Genitives,4"
long description: Moderately differentiated, with adjectives and relative clauses collapsed

name: Adjectives without Nouns
long description: Adjective may not occur without noun

name: Adjectives without Nouns
long description: Adjective may occur without noun, and without marking

name: Adjectives without Nouns
long description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by prefix

name: Adjectives without Nouns
long description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by suffix

name: Adjectives without Nouns
long description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by preceding word

name: Adjectives without Nouns
long description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by following word

name: Adjectives without Nouns
description: Marked by mixed or other strategies
long description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by mixed or other strategies

name: Action Nominal Constructions
long description: Sentential: dependent-marking of the finite clause is retained for S, A and P

name: Action Nominal Constructions
long description: Possessive-Accusative: S/A treated as possessors, P retains sentential marking

name: Action Nominal Constructions
long description: Ergative-Possessive: S/P treated as possessors, A treated differently

name: Action Nominal Constructions
long description: Double-Possessive: All major arguments treated as possessors

name: Action Nominal Constructions
long description: Mixed: Several patterns in the same language

name: Action Nominal Constructions
long description: Not both A and P in the same construction

name: Nominal and Verbal Conjunction
long description: Nominal and verbal conjunction are largely identical

name: Nominal and Verbal Conjunction
long description: Nominal and verbal conjunction are different

name: Nominal and Verbal Conjunction
long description: Nominal and verbal conjunction are primarily expressed by juxtaposition

name: Perfective/Imperfective Aspect
long description: No grammatical marking of perfective/imperfective distinction

name: The Past Tense
long description: Past/non-past distinction marked; no remoteness distinction

name: The Past Tense
long description: Past/non-past distinction marked; 2-3 degrees of remoteness distinguished

name: The Past Tense
long description: Past/non-past distinction marked; at least 4 degrees of remoteness distinguished

name: The Past Tense
long description: No grammatical marking of past/non-past distinction

name: The Future Tense
long description: No inflectional marking of future/non-future distinction

name: The Perfect
long description: Perfect of the 'have'-type (derived from a possessive construction)

name: The Perfect
long description: Perfect derived from word meaning 'finish' or 'already'

name: Position of Tense-Aspect Affixes
long description: Combination of tense-aspect strategies with none primary

name: The Morphological Imperative
long description: The language has morphologically dedicated second singular as well as second plural imperatives

name: The Morphological Imperative
long description: The language has morphologically dedicated second singular imperatives but no morphologically dedicated second plural imperatives

name: The Morphological Imperative
long description: The language has morphologically dedicated second plural imperatives but no morphologically dedicated second singular imperatives

name: The Morphological Imperative
long description: The language has morphologically dedicated second person imperatives that do not distinguish between singular and plural

name: The Morphological Imperative
long description: The language has no morphologically dedicated second-person imperatives at all

name: The Prohibitive
long description: The prohibitive uses the verbal construction of the second singular imperative and a sentential negative strategy found in (indicative) declaratives

name: The Prohibitive
long description: The prohbitive uses the verbal construction of the second singular imperative and a sentential negative strategy not found in (indicative) declaratives

name: The Prohibitive
long description: The prohibitive uses a verbal construction other than the second singular imperative and a sentential negative strategy found in (indicative) declaratives

name: The Prohibitive
long description: The prohibitive uses a verbal construction other than the second singular imperative and a sentential negative strategy not found in (indicative) declaratives

name: Imperative-Hortative Systems
long description: The language has a maximal system, but not a minimal one

name: Imperative-Hortative Systems
long description: The language has a minimal system, but not a maximal one

name: Imperative-Hortative Systems
long description: The language has both a maximal and a minimal system

name: Imperative-Hortative Systems
long description: The language has neither a maximal nor a minimal system

name: Situational Possibility
long description: The language can express situational possibility with affixes on verbs

name: Situational Possibility
long description: The language cannot express situational possibility with affixes on verbs, but with verbal constructions

name: Situational Possibility
long description: The language cannot express situational possibility with affixes on verbs or with verbal constructions, but with other kinds of markers

name: Epistemic Possibility
long description: The language can express epistemic possibility with verbal constructions

name: Epistemic Possibility
long description: The language cannot express epistemic possibility with verbal constructions, but with affixes on verbs

name: Epistemic Possibility
long description: The language cannot express epistemic possibility with verbal constructions or with affixes on verbs, but with other kinds of markers

description: Overlap for both possibility and necessity
long description: The language has markers that can code both situational and epistemic modality, both for possibility and necessity

name: Overlap between Situational and Epistemic Modal Marking
description: Overlap for either possibility or necessity
long description: The language has markers that can code both situational and epistemic modality, but only for possibility or for necessity

name: Overlap between Situational and Epistemic Modal Marking
long description: The language has no markers that can code both situational and epistemic modality

long description: There are no non-iconic reciprocal constructions.
